channel.title: History on IdlePhysicist
channel.description: Recent content in History on IdlePhysicist

item.title: The Sea Interferometer at Dover Heights, NSW
item.description: Dover Heights was a Second World War RADAR station, taken over by the CSIRO Dept. of Radiophysics after war. CSIRO then repurposed the station for solar observations as well as observations of the first “radio stars”. For the first 4 years of operation, the station used arrays of Yagi antennae, with ever increasing numbers of elements. 1950 saw the arrival of the first dish antenna, a 4.9m parabolic dish mounted to the roof of the WWII block house.
